Author: jl777c#5810
Content: get the komodod with the -addressindex=1 -spentindex=1 -timestampindex=1 synced before doing anything with the explorer

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: once the daemon is in sync, then install the explorer

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then there wont be any issue about loading blocks

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: @Fartmasta anyone can create a stablecoin provided they have the backing.   there could be lots of stablecoins in the future - or even gov sanctioned stablecoins.  that is an economic, jurisdiction/legal problem.  if they are UTXO (bitcoin protocol) based, they can be tokenized and used around the kmd ecosystem with a gatewayCC contract.

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
@D.rabbani @CORS1ER 

I'm seeing a lot of new devs show up.

Just a reminder, the new streamlined documentation that's targeted for new developers is almost done.

You can use it in advance here:

https://siddhartha-komodo.github.io/slate/#introduction

We hope to get it to the main website very soon. Just finishing a few things -- namely, the gateways smart contract and some instructions on creating a cc pubkey address, and then a final check down to make sure all is good.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: https://bitcoinmagazine.com/articles/multigateway-the-first-decentralized-crypto-currency-exchange-1416826610/

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this gives a bit of background on MGW (yes, from 4 years ago!)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: first step is to understand MGW

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: reading

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: Ok, so question

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
The idea of MGW seems to be broader than just an exchange, but maybe I'm wrong.

I say that because as I read through the tutorial, I see that there can be binding between tokens, gateways, and oracles. Maybe I'm wrong, but this makes it seem like gateways shouldn't be described as just an exchange?

How would you most simply describe gateways, considering these things?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the gateways CC implements a gateway

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the exchanging is by a different mechanism

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: oracles is a helper CC that helps gateways see data from the external chain

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: how can we describe a gateway? I've read through all the material available, and do not yet have a simple description that captures the vision.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what a gateway does is creates a token from deposit of a real crypto

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and when that token is withdrawn, it is converted back into the real crypto

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you know, just like what an exchange does

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: Ok, that is much simpler.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you deposit BTC, you get a balance in the exchange

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you withdraw from exchange and get BTC in the address you specify

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in between, it exists as some DB entry

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for gateways CC, it exists as an assets CC token

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
Ok, good. 

Let me see if in the tutorial documentation I can get all the rpc calls real quick.

The only other thing I'm sure I need is an example of each rpc call. (I do not have access to my other node at the moment; it is indisposed.)

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: So, a flow of "I entered exactly this", followed by "I received this exact output." For each command, all the way through the whole cc flow.
